intro: Solms-laubachia incana, commonly known as the woolly solms-laubachia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes plants such as spiderworts and arum family members. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Solms-laubachia incana is often found in open grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in full sun.
